meanings.definition: The act of moving around an area to ensure safety or security.
meanings.sent1: The patrolling of the neighborhood by the security guard keeps us safe.
meanings.sent2: Police officers often do patrolling in the city to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The cat did its own version of patrolling the house, making sure no toy was left unattended.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky seemed to be patrolling the horizon, watching over the land below.
meanings.sent5: The patrolling of the lifeguard along the beach was a reassuring sight for swimmers.

meanings.definition: To regularly walk or drive around an area to guard or protect it.
meanings.sent1: The security guard patrolling the building at night ensures its safety.
meanings.sent2: I saw a police car patrolling the streets last night.
meanings.sent3: The dog enjoys patrolling the backyard, making sure no squirrel intrudes.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight patrolling through the trees created a magical atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The knight patrolling the castle walls looked vigilant and determined.
